\n
\n
COMPANY OVERVIEW
\n
Cresco Labs is one of the largest public, vertically integrated, multistate operators in the cannabis industry. Our portfolio of in-house cultivated and manufactured brands features some of the highest quality, most awarded and most popular cannabis products in America. With dozens of locations nationwide, our owned and operated Sunnyside® dispensaries provide a welcoming, positive, judgement-free place to shop for anyone at any point on their cannabis journey.
Founded in 2013, Cresco Labs' mission is to normalize and professionalize cannabis through our passionate employees. As stewards of the cannabis industry, our teams are constantly focused on supporting the needs of our fellow colleagues, consumers, customers, and communities alike. With a focus on Social Equity and Educational Development, our SEEDTM initiative ensures that our company reflects the communities in which we serve, ensuring equal opportunity for all to have the knowledge and resources to work in and own businesses in cannabis.
At Cresco Labs, we aim to revolutionize and lead the nation's cannabis industry with a focus on quality and consistency of product, and to bring legitimacy to the industry with the highest level of integrity and professionalism.
If you're interested in joining our mission, click the below links to join our team today!
\n
MISSION STATEMENT
\n
At Cresco, we aim to lead the nation's cannabis industry with a focus on regulatory compliance, product consistency, and customer satisfaction. Our operations bring legitimacy to the cannabis industry by acting with the highest level of integrity, strictly adhering to regulations, and promoting the clinical efficacy of cannabis. As Cresco grows, we will operate with the same level of professionalism and precision in each new market we move in to.
\n
\n
JOB SUMMARY
\n
Cresco Labs is seeking a Data Analyst to support the Retail team by transforming complex data into actionable insights. This role will partner with Merchandising, Marketing, Planning, Finance, and Operations to evaluate retail performance, develop dashboards and reporting frameworks, and provide recommendations that guide decision-making at both the market and store level. The Data Analyst will apply analytical judgment to interpret trends in sales, pricing, promotions, and customer behavior, ensuring insights directly inform strategy.
\n
CORE JOB DUTIES
\n
\n
Partner with Merchandising, Marketing, and Regional Ops to analyze campaign effectiveness, customer behavior, and category trends, providing actionable recommendations for future initiatives.
\n
Design and manage recurring reporting frameworks on sales, inventory, and promotions, ensuring insights are timely, accurate, and strategically relevant.
\n
Apply expertise in retail data and reporting tools to help cross-functional teams leverage analytics to achieve business goals.
\n
Develop and evolve dashboards and data visualization tools to improve accessibility of insights for cross-functional teams.
\n
Ensure data integrity across systems by proactively identifying discrepancies, conducting root cause analysis, and recommending process improvements.
\n
Conduct pricing, profitability, and margin analyses across categories and regions, identifying risks and opportunities for competitive advantage.
\n
Assist in scenario modeling and sensitivity analyses to support demand planning, promotions, and financial forecasting.
\n
Translate data into business insights that inform executive decision-making, presenting findings and recommendations in clear, compelling ways.
\n
\n
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, EDUCATION AND SKILLS
\n
\n
1–3 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or related role (internships or academic projects may count).
\n
Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Analytics, or related field.
\n
Proficiency in Excel and SQL with working knowledge of data visualization tools (Tableau, preferred).
\n
Ability to understand business operations, processes, and translate data into business insights that "tell a story" or aid decision-making
\n
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and communicate data and information with attention to detail and accuracy
\n
Effective communicator with ability to present findings to non-technical stakeholders.
\n
Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to prioritize multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
\n
\n
BENEFITS
\n
Cresco Labs is proud to offer eligible employees a robust offering of benefits including, major medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(K)-match program, FSA/HSA programs, LTD/STD options, life insurance and AD&D. We also offer eligible employees paid holidays and paid time off. Other rewards may include annual discretionary bonuses, stock options as well as participation in our employee discount program. Benefits eligibility for permanent positions may vary by full-time or part-time roles, location, or position.
\n
\n
ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS
\n
\n
Must be 21 years of age or older to apply
\n
Must comply with all legal or company regulations for working in the industry
\n
\n
Cresco Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all applicants will be considered without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.
\n
\n
California Consumer Privacy Act ("CCPA") Notice to Applicants:
\n
Please read the
California Employee Privacy Notice
("CA Privacy Notice") regarding Sunnyside* and its affiliate Cresco Labs' policies pertaining to the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information. This CA Privacy Notice supplements the information contained in the
Sunnyside* Privacy Policy
and applies to California resident employees and job applicants. Applicants with disabilities may access this notice in an alternative format by contacting
CCPAnotice@crescolabs.com
\n
Reporting a Scam:
Cresco Labs is aware of fictitious employment offers being circulated from various sources. Many of these schemes consist of an alleged offer of employment with Cresco Labs with the intention of gaining personal information, including payment and/or banking information. Be aware that fraudulent job offers and correspondence may appear legitimate: they may feature a Cresco Labs logo, they may appear to originate from an official-looking email address or web site, or they may be sent by individuals purporting to represent Cresco Labs or an entity which includes the word Cresco Labs in its name.
Please note that Cresco Labs
does not
ask for payment or personal banking information as a condition of employment. Any personal information is requested for payroll or state badging purposes only. Applications can be securely submitted through our career's pages.
\n
We are working diligently to block this from happening. Beware if an offer of employment looks too good to be true. Never divulge personal and banking information or send money if you are unsure of the authenticity of an email or other communication in the name of Cresco Labs.
\n
If you are in doubt, please contact us at
Report-a-spam@crescolabs.com
with questions.
